teams.name: Put Things Right  - PTR
teams.loan_because: To deliver Research and Developmental Services for all sectors across; south Sudan and other poor areas around Sudan and gradually in connect with global locations on the basis of network , and the services are going to be arranged  in the fields of heath, education, agriculture, microeconomic projects, banking and others...
teams.description:
Is a  young line of  collective new generations who are standing up after the Sudanese war. Soon our team is going joined by colorful Regional and Global members from: Islands, Sudan, Europe, Africa, Asia, America and Australia ; "gradually".  The starting point is in Khartoum - Sudan.
John Jada Youngo,
Managing Coordinator, President and Founder.

http://www.fordsisea.yolasite.com 
Cell: 249-904997293.

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142

teams.name: Fight Fistulas
teams.loan_because:
This team was founded after some members were profoundly touched by the documentary - "A Walk to Beautiful" - which can now be viewed at  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3w-fOmovijc.  

The 9 min video "Fistula Pilgrims" tells the story of Telanish, a young girl in Ethiopia who was married at 10, pregnant at 11 and gave birth to a stillborn child at 12. As a result of a long and obstructed labour, she has a fistula and is left incontinent, an outcast from her community: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6K7BLR6MQ0E

"From Despair to Dignity" is a short but powerful 5 minute video: http://www.yaninamanolova.com/fistula/index.html

Some of our team members have visited the Fistula Hospital in Addis Ababa in Sept 2010. You can find the photos of our trip here: http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.1498836905487.2071607.1071085140&type=1&l=37cf97fe75
teams.description:
We make Kiva loans in recognition of the Hamlin Fistula Hospital and its supporters worldwide, which fight to correct a childbirth injury that can leave a young woman incontinent, leaking wastes, scorned and ostracized.  A $450 surgical repair usually solves the problem and restores their lives.  For more information, please check out the pages of the different global partners and donors of the Hamlin Fistula Hospital:

Japan: http://english.fistula-japan.org
Netherlands: www.fistulahospital.nl 
New Zealand: www.hamlinfistula.org.nz
Sweden: www.fistulasjukhuset.se
Switzerland: www.womenshope.ch
UK: www.hamlinfistulauk.org
USA: http://www.hamlinfistulausa.org; http://www.fistulafoundation.org

Search the web and do your online shopping through iGive to help us raise more funds for fistula patients: www.iGive.com/fight-fistulas.

teams.description: Travelers who collect miles and points and seek free flights, hotel rooms and upgrades where possible. Here we seek to give back and invite everyone to join with us and make a difference.

teams.name: Humans Against Unjust Capitalism
teams.whereabouts: Anyplace where there is a heart to give.
teams.loan_because: We believe in the beautiful fact that all humans are equal and should thus be treated so. Ergo, it is our utmost duty, as those who have been privileged from our forefathers greed, to give back our excess to those who it was originally taken from. In doing so, we hope to achieve a more balanced and equal world, that our children might not feel shame when they consider how we lived our lives.
teams.description: Small yet Dedicated

We aim to decrease world suck.

Happy lending!

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: The Custody Project
teams.loan_because: Our Mission: To promote the general welfare, both directly and indirectly, of women and their children as a unit as related to care, custody, and visitation issues.
teams.description: Needs help to with children and families in emergency crisis.

teams.name: Team Europe
teams.loan_because: We think Kiva is a unique opportunity for people all over the world to assist entrepreneurs in improving their businesses and communities.
teams.description: We are European lenders (EU, EFTA, and all those who feel they belong) who share the belief in Kiva's vision.

teams.name: Bellinghamsters
teams.loan_because: We are lucky to live in one of the most beautiful and rich areas on the planet. We want to share our good fortune with others. We admire and respect those who are working to create good lives for themselves and others.
teams.description: We are residents of Bellingham, Washington in the Northwest of the United States of America. Our city is known for its rich culture, beautiful environment and healthy lifestyle.

teams.name: Couch Surfing
teams.loan_because: it's the Couch Surfing way
teams.description:
Couch Surfers

CouchSurfing

teams.name: Students of Columbia Bible College
teams.loan_because: "...you shall not harden your heart or shut your hand against your poor brother, but you shall open your hand to him and lend him sufficient for his need, whatever it may be." Deuteronomy 15:7-8
teams.description: We are a student-led group. Alumni of CBC are also very welcome.

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.loan_because:

teams.name: Raj Shahani Memorial Team
teams.loan_because: This team has been created in memory of Raj Shahani who passed away in March 2010 at the tender age of 30. Raj was an active and enthusiastic Kiva lender. He had felt Kiva offered the unique opportunity to help entrepreneurs build their businesses and better their lives. We lend because we wish to continue his work. Raj's spirit will live on by our helping those in need.
teams.description: Our team is made up of friends and family members of Raj whose relentless pursuit to help others is our inspiration. Together as a team, we can and will make a difference in the world.

teams.name: Green Partnerships
teams.loan_because: We want to help create more sustainable and equitable communities all around the world.
teams.description:
We lend to individuals and groups engaged in businesses and services that help them earn a living but also help to protect the environment in their part of the world. We also strive to build green partnerships in our own communities by supporting the women and men who provide businesses, services, and products that benefit people and the Earth. 

Some of our team members mainly fund green loans, while others choose to designate a fraction of their loans to green enterprises. These are examples of just some of the loans Green Partnerships has helped to fund:

abaca              www.kiva.org/lend/479304 
bees and beehives   www.kiva.org/lend/416522

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: Saskatchewan
teams.loan_because: Spreading the boom is a great idea!
teams.description: We're a loose amalgamation of everyday normal people living in what some people would call the middle of nowhere!

teams.name: Calgary, Canada
teams.loan_because: Living in such a great city as Calgary with all the opportunities that entails, surely we can make an effort to help others less fortunate. We all can make a big difference with just a small loan.
teams.description:
This team is for residents of Calgary, former residents, people wtih friends and family here or for anyone who really loves the city!

To those who do not wish to receive an email when messages are posted to the board, there is a simple fix: Go to your portfolio, then your account, then email preferences and you can disable/enable from there. I myself have turned it off as I am a member of several groups and do not want to receive masses of emails.

teams.name: Narara Valley Baptist Church
teams.loan_because: We, as a church, have a heart for communities on both a local and global scale. We seek to be a river of blessing to those that are not as fortunate as us.
teams.description:
Narara Valley Baptist Church is increasingly becoming a church that is growing in our desperation for God and passion for people. We seek to encounter Jesus in a personal way and engage with people in the community of the Central Coast and beyond as we share the Gospel in word, deed and sign.

We believe that encountering Jesus can be a daily life experience. The times when we gather together (Sunday worship and Growth Groups) seek to inspire and equip, as well as celebrate who Jesus is and what He’s doing in our midst.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

***TEAM RESOURCES***
Secular Loans
http://goo.gl/wtDkJ

Field Partners - Social and Secular Ratings:
www.tinyurl.com/AASFSHNR-MFIs

***OTHER RESOURCES:***
Starfish List:
http://starfish.dynalias.org/

KivaLens:
http://www.kivalens.org/

Toolkit for analyzing Kiva data:
http://build.kiva.org/

teams.name: India
teams.loan_because: "What we should aim at is the creation of people power, which is opposed to the power of violence and is different from the coercive power of state." - Vinoba Bhave
teams.description:
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty.

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva/2012/08/15/kiva-launches-in-india.html

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: The Barefoot Investor
teams.loan_because: We believe everyone can tread their own path.

teams.name: GLBT (Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender) Kivans & Friends
teams.loan_because: We are out and proud and know what it is like to face barriers. We are privileged to help our entrepreneurs achieve their own equality. We thank our friends who join us in our loans & in supporting GLBT rights.
teams.description: We are gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, homosexual, and heterosexual people from all over the world.

teams.name: Indie Travel Podcast
teams.loan_because: as independent travellers, we understand the need for grassroots funding of small businesses in the places we visit.
teams.description: We are a group of independent travellers, who have met through http://indietravelpodcast.com

teams.name: warhammer4peace
teams.loan_because: were buying your loyalty now
teams.description: this team was started by an 11yr old warhammer fan boy who loves to help and has a big family

teams.name: Bowen
teams.loan_because: It's cool to give others an opportunity to thrive and create something that benefits their families.
teams.description: We are family and Bowen is the name of one of our pets.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Capgemini Academy
teams.loan_because: The Capgemini Academy wants to support entrepreneurs across the globe. We want to give people in other parts of the world a little financial help to start or expand there business.
teams.description: Collegues.

teams.loan_because: We believe everyone can tread their own path.

teams.name: Share - Partage
teams.loan_because:
we want to help individuals and groups  to improve their financial situations by their own efforts and activities. This will respect their individualities and affirm that their progress is the result  of their own intense work.  

Nous désirons aider des individus et des groupes à améliorer leurs situations financières par leurs propres efforts et activités. Cela respectera leurs valeurs individuelles, et affirmera que leur progrès est le résultat de leur intense travail personnel.
teams.description:
The members of our team believe in the great principle of Sharing. 

"Sharing and Justice, Brotherhood and Freedom are not new concepts. From the dawn of time mankind has linked his aspirations to these beckoning stars. Now, my friends, shall we anchor them in the world"

- Maitreya, the World Teacher

Les membres du groupe croient dans le grand principe du Partage et tentent de le mettre en pratique.

teams.name: Reptile Keepers
teams.loan_because:
Do we really need a reason to give?

Most people think reptile keepers are as cold-blooded as their pets. Hopefully this team can show a few people that reptile keepers aren't strange and creepy.
teams.description: People that keep snakes and lizards as pets.

teams.name: Stuff You Should Know from HowStuffWorks.com
teams.loan_because: We care.
teams.description: Arguably the finest assemblage of people who have never met dedicated to the common purpose of hastening global peace in $25 increments.

teams.name: Team Hattrick
teams.description: A group of people who all play hattrick.

teams.name: Team Hattrick
teams.description: A group of people who all play hattrick.

teams.name: London
teams.loan_because:
Looking for Team members who want to become more involved in promoting the team and expanding our membership. Contact Richard to join the leadership. 

If each team member posted a link to this team on their favourite social media site we should see a spike in membership.. 520 as at 15th March 2013

teams.name: Autonomobilia
teams.loan_because: ...geben ist seliger denn nehmen...
teams.description: .....da geht noch was.....

teams.name: Netherlands
teams.loan_because: het mensen helpt een zelfstandig bestaan op te bouwen.
teams.description: FairSpirit microkrediet promoot Kiva in Nederland. Doe jij ook mee met het FairSpirit team?

teams.name: KG - Wish You Were Here
teams.loan_because: We lost Kyle on December 3, 2009. He was a wonderful person who had a big heart and our lives will never be the same without him. Kyle always loved kids and would have made an amazing father. We want to lend money to help someone who will make a difference in a child's life...in that way we want to honor his memory. We can help kids by helping their parents provide them a better life.
teams.description: A group of individuals trying to do something good to honor the memory of a very good person.

teams.name: One for One
teams.loan_because: One person here can make a difference to one person in a developing country.
teams.description: Young professionals (and friends and family of) who want to give back!

teams.name: Bangladesh
teams.loan_because: they can make a difference.
teams.description: Bangladeshis and friends united to help others

teams.name: Nansen
teams.loan_because: Global changes starts with local actions
teams.description: Nansen is a digital agency based in Stockholm, London, Chicago, New York and Washington D.C
